definition: to lay (a foundation)/to conquer (a city etc)/to shoot down (a bird etc)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle

sentences.english: I thought he would have gone a bit further to explain how Mao Zedong took over entire China.
sentences.chinese: 我以为他会进一步解释毛是如何打下全中国的。

sentences.english: Also develops the international market for us to build the good solid foundation.
sentences.chinese: 也为我们开拓国际市场打下良实的基础。

sentences.english: This has laid a solid foundation for the follow-up study.
sentences.chinese: 从而为本文的后续研究打下了坚实的基础。

sentences.english: This and only this will establish the basis for a transition to anything.
sentences.chinese: 唯有如此，才能为建立任何的过渡方案打下基础。

sentences.english: Objective To lay a solid technological foundation of large-scale commercialized production of Quwencao.
sentences.chinese: 目的为驱蚊草进行大规模的商业化生产打下技术基础。

sentences.english: Taylorism is etched deeply in corporate culture.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒制给企业文化打下了深深的烙印。

sentences.english: All of the work made foundation of developing solid rocket-ramjet engine.
sentences.chinese: 为固体火箭冲压发动机试验研究打下基础。

sentences.english: Your mother’s characteristics and your father’s were learned and held onto by the brain.
sentences.chinese: 你学到了你父母的性格特点并将此在大脑上打下烙印。

sentences.english: A probe into the formative mechanism of criminal mind will form the foundation of crime prevention.
sentences.chinese: 探讨这种心理形成的机制，可以为犯罪预防打下基础。

sentences.english: Lay the foundation for future growth.
I don't mind playing second fiddle in this group.
sentences.chinese: 我不介意在这个组织里打下手。

sentences.english: Cases are known where trioecy provides for an optimal mating system.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，单全异株为最适交配系统打下基础。

sentences.english: Openness can provide the basis for new opportunities and relationships.
sentences.chinese: 率真可以为新的机遇，人际关系打下基础。

sentences.english: Did not believe that the defeat is rational. I will overcome a legend.
sentences.chinese: 我只要拼到底，不去相信失败有理，我打下一个传奇。

sentences.english: The results make a solid basement for broadening the research of symbolic dynamics and star product.
sentences.chinese: 为进一步推广符号动力学中的星花积的研究打下基础。

sentences.english: He swung the wheel so fast I had to jump aside.
sentences.chinese: 他很快打下舵，动作很快，我必须跳到一边去。

definition: to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to stand/to have a footing/to be established/to base oneself on
